p: The extract of brown algae Padina pavonica under investigation exhibited an interesting pharmacological potential with relevant health-protecting effects. Our findings confirmed this macroalgae as a promising and unlimited source of new functional food ingredients and bioactive compounds. Moreover, this study provides convincing and integrated evidences that EPP possesses anti-cancer properties towards osteosarcoma cell lines and can be used as a nutraceutical tool to prevent bone-related diseases or to support the current treatment protocols for osteosarcoma.
